ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: On average, do you have trouble getting to sleep?
On average, does it take you more than 30 minutes to fall asleep?
Does it take you more than 30 minutes to fall asleep more than 3 times per week?
Has it taken you more than 30 minutes to fall asleep for at least 3 months?
Has it taken you more than 30 minutes to fall asleep for at least 1 month?
On average, do you wake up during the night and can't fall back asleep?
Do you wake up during the night more than 3 times per week?
Have you been waking up during the night for at least 3 months?
Have you been waking up during the night for at least 1 month?
On average, do you wake up too early in the morning and can't fall back asleep?
Do you wake up too early in the morning more than 3 times per week?
Have you been waking up early in the morning for at least 3 months?
Have you been waking up early in the morning for at least 1 month?
On average, do you wake up from sleep feeling tired or not fully rested?
Do you wake up from sleep feeling tired more than 3 times per week?
Have you been waking up from sleep tired for at least 3 months?
Have you been waking up from sleep tired for at least 1 month?
Are you often fatigued or sluggish during the day?
Has your inability to sleep or daytime fatigue ever caused problems with your friends or family?
Have you been unable to participate or greatly decreased your participation in important activities like work, sports or household duties because of your inability to sleep or daytime fatigue?
Has your inability to sleep or your daytime fatigue often interfered with your working or taking care of household responsibilities?
Has your inability to sleep or your daytime fatigue often affected your mood (made you feel sad, irritable or depressed)?
Are you currently being treated for or treating yourself for a sleep problem?
If you are being treated for a sleep problem, are you using: Psychotherapy (e.g. CBT)?
If you are being treated for a sleep problem, are you using: Medication?
If you are being treated for a sleep problem, are you using: Herbs?
If using medication or herbs to treat your sleep problem, which ones?
Do you have a regular bedtime?
Do you usually go to bed between the hours of 9pm and 12am?
Do you usually wake up between the hours of 5am and 8am?
Do you engage in shift work?
Do you frequently travel across multiple time zones?
Have you traveled across multiple time zones in the last three months?
Do you snore? Has your bed partner ever told you that you snore?
Do you often have nasal congestion/stuffiness at night?
Do you have difficulty breathing during sleep or stop breathing during sleep?
Do you awake at night gasping for breath?
Has anyone ever told you that you appear to be having difficulty breathing when you sleep?
Wake up with headaches in the morning
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = Do not know; -9 = Missing value

ElementDescription: Do you have difficulty driving for an hour because you are so sleepy?
Have you ever nodded off or fallen asleep while driving a vehicle?
Notes: 1= Yes; 2= No; 333= Do Not know; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Do you frequently wake with a bad taste in my mouth, or a dry mouth and throat?
I sometimes wake up with a pounding or irregular heartbeat
I don't feel rested or refreshed, even after 8 or 10 hours of sleep
Do your legs twitch or kick during the night?
Do you have leg cramps at night?
Do you suffer from cold feet?
Has a doctor ever told you that you suffer from narcolepsy?
Have you ever awakened from nighttime sleep with terribly frightening dreams?
Do you sleepwalk? Have you been told by others that you sleepwalk?
I''ve had some new sources of distress in my life (loss of a loved one, relationship ended, medical situation, etc.)
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I''ve recently had challenges with a relationship involving a family member
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I''ve recently had challenges with a relationship involving a friend
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I''ve recently dealt with a lot of stress at work
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I''ve personally dealt with a challenging medical situation within the past year
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: My schedule at work or school has changed significantly
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I feel like I spend too much time in bed not sleeping
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I feel like I spend too much time in bed worrying about the fact that I''m not sleeping
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: The total hours of sleep I get each night varies throughout the week
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I spend time reading in bed
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I spend time playing video games (on phone, iPad, other device) in bed
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I spend time in bed texting or talking on the phone/Facetime
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I spend time in bed streaming videos or watching TV
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I drink coffee, soda, energy drinks, or other drinks with caffeine after 12 p.m.
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I drink alcohol in the evening
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I use cannabis/marijuana in the evening
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I exercise within 3 hours of bedtime
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I watch really intense shows close to bedtime
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I find myself worrying about things in bed
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: My quality of sleep has been an issue for a long time (even when younger)
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I would describe myself as someone who has always worried about things
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I would describe myself as someone who has had a lot of stress in my life
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I have always had a problem with feeling tense or having tense muscles
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: Other people in my family have had problems with their sleep
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I feel like my sleep has gotten worse as I''ve gotten older
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me

ElementDescription: I''ve had some new sources of ''good'' stress in my life (a new relationship, new baby, new job, starting college, etc.)
Notes: 1 = Not at all like me; 2 = A little bit like me; 3 = A moderate amount like me; 4 = A great deal like me
